name: Tom Yum Goong
description: A hot and sour soup with shrimp and a variety of herbs and spices.
instructions: Bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a pot.
Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal to the pot and let it boil for 2 minutes.
Add shrimp, mushrooms, and tomatoes to the pot and let it boil until the shrimp turns pink.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar to the pot and stir well.
Add bird's eye chili and coriander leaves to the pot.
Remove from heat and serve hot.

name: Som Tum
description: A spicy salad made from shredded unripe papaya, tomatoes, green beans, garlic, chili peppers, and peanuts.
instructions: Peel the unripe papaya and shred it into thin strips.
In a mortar and pestle, pound garlic and chili peppers until they are well combined.
Add green beans and pound them lightly.
Add palm sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice to the mortar and pestle and mix well.
Add shredded papaya and tomatoes to the mortar and pestle and gently pound them until the flavors are well combined.
Serve the salad with peanuts on top.

name: Nam Ma Kam
description: A refreshing Thai tamarind juice made with tamarind pulp, sugar, and water.
instructions: Soak the tamarind pulp in 2 cups of warm water for 10-15 minutes. Use your hands to break up the pulp and extract as much juice as possible.
Strain the tamarind juice through a fine mesh strainer to remove any pulp and seeds.
Add the remaining 2 cups of water and sugar to the tamarind juice, and stir well to dissolve the sugar.
Chill the juice in the refrigerator, or serve over ice.

name: Nam Manglak
description: A sweet and sour Thai mango juice made with fresh ripe mangoes, sugar, and water.
instructions: Peel and chop the mangoes, discarding the pit.
Blend the mangoes in a blender or food processor until smooth.
Strain the mango puree through a fine mesh strainer to remove any fibers or lumps.
Add the water and sugar to the mango juice, and stir well to dissolve the sugar.
Chill the juice in the refrigerator, or serve over ice.

name: Nam Yen
description: A sweet and creamy Thai iced milk tea made with black tea, evaporated milk, and sweetened condensed milk.
instructions: Boil the water and steep the tea bags in the water for 3-5 minutes.
Remove the tea bags and let the tea cool to room temperature.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the evaporated milk and sweetened condensed milk until well combined.
Fill a glass with ice, and pour in the cooled tea and milk mixture.
Stir well, and serve immediately.

name: Pad Thai
description: Stir-fried rice noodles with eggs, tofu, shrimp, tamarind pulp, fish sauce, dried shrimp, garlic, shallots, palm sugar, and chili peppers, garnished with bean sprouts and chopped peanuts.
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in warm water until they are soft, then drain and set aside.
Heat up a pan with oil and add garlic and shallots. Stir until fragrant.
Add shrimp and stir until cooked.
Add eggs and stir until cooked.
Add the rice noodles, tofu, tamarind pulp, fish sauce, dried shrimp, palm sugar, and chili peppers, and stir well.
Add bean sprouts and stir well.
Garnish with chopped peanuts and serve hot.

name: Som Tam
description: A spicy salad made from shredded unripe papaya, tomatoes, green beans, peanuts, and chili peppers.
instructions: Peel and shred the unripe papaya into thin strips.
In a large mortar and pestle, pound garlic and bird's eye chili until they are crushed.
Add shredded papaya, green beans, and tomatoes to the mortar and pestle and pound lightly.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar to the mortar and pestle and pound until the ingredients are mixed well.
Transfer the salad to a serving dish and sprinkle with crushed peanuts.
Serve with sticky rice.

name: Khao Soi
description: A coconut curry soup with egg noodles and chicken or beef, topped with crispy fried egg noodles and pickled vegetables.
instructions: Heat a pan over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of oil.
Add yellow curry paste and stir until fragrant.
Add chicken or beef to the pan and cook until it is browned on all sides.
Add coconut milk to the pan and stir well.
Add fish sauce, palm sugar, and lime juice to the pan and stir well.
In a separate pot, boil egg noodles until they are cooked. Drain the noodles and set them aside.
In a pan, fry crispy egg noodles until they are golden brown and set them aside.
Add the cooked egg noodles to the curry soup and stir well.
Serve the curry soup in a bowl and top with crispy egg noodles, shallots, coriander, and pickled mustard greens.

name: Tom Kha Gai
description: A spicy and sour coconut milk soup with chicken, galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and chili peppers.
instructions: Heat up a pot of coconut milk over medium heat.
Add galangal, lemongrass, and kaffir lime leaves, and bring to a boil.
Add chicken and chili peppers, and cook until the chicken is done.
Garnish with more kaffir lime leaves and serve hot.

name: Pad See Ew
description: Stir-fried flat rice noodles with Chinese broccoli, eggs, soy sauce, oyster sauce, garlic, and sometimes meat or seafood.
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in warm water until they are soft, then drain and set aside.
Heat up a pan with oil and add garlic. Stir until fragrant.
Add meat or seafood (if using) and stir until cooked.
Add eggs and stir until cooked.
Add the rice noodles, Chinese broccoli, soy sauce, and oyster sauce, and stir well.
Serve hot.

name: Green Curry
description: A spicy curry made with coconut milk, meat or vegetables, green chili peppers, and Thai herbs.
instructions: Heat up a pot of coconut milk over medium heat.
Add green curry paste and stir until fragrant.
Add meat or vegetables and stir until cooked.
Add Thai herbs and stir well.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Massaman Curry
description: A mild and sweet curry made with coconut milk, meat or vegetables, potatoes, peanuts, and Massaman curry paste.
instructions: Heat up a pot of coconut milk over medium heat.
Add Massaman curry paste and stir until fragrant.
Add meat or vegetables and stir until cooked.
Add potatoes and peanuts, and cook until the potatoes are tender.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Laab
description: A spicy salad made with minced meat or tofu, shallots, chili peppers, lime juice, fish sauce, and roasted rice powder.
instructions: Heat up a pan and cook the minced meat or tofu until it's done.
Add shallots and chili peppers, and stir until fragrant.
Add fish sauce and lime juice, and stir well.
Add roasted rice powder and stir well.
Serve with fresh vegetables.

name: Mango Sticky Rice
description: A sweet and creamy dessert made with glutinous rice, coconut milk, and fresh mango slices.
instructions: Rinse the glutinous rice several times until the water runs clear, then soak it in water for at least 30 minutes.

Drain the rice and transfer it to a pot. Add water and a pinch of salt, and bring it to a boil over high heat. Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer, covered, for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked.
In a separate pot, heat up the coconut milk with sugar and salt, and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Keep it warm over low heat.
Slice the mango into thin pieces.
Once the rice is done, transfer it to a large bowl. Pour the warm coconut milk over the rice and stir well. Let it sit for 10-15 minutes to absorb the coconut milk.
Serve the rice with fresh mango slices on top.

name: Pla Pao
description: A whole grilled fish stuffed with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and garlic.
instructions: Clean the fish and pat it dry with paper towels.
Stuff the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and garlic inside the fish.
Wrap the fish in banana leaves or aluminum foil.
Grill the fish over medium heat for about 10-15 minutes on each side.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, fish sauce, palm sugar, and lime juice until well combined.
Serve the grilled fish with the sauce and fresh coriander.

name: Pad Krapow Moo Saap
description: Stir-fried minced pork with Thai basil and chili peppers, served over rice and topped with a fried egg.
instructions: Cook rice according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and chili peppers to the pan and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add minced pork to the pan and stir-fry until it is cooked.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and sugar to the pan and stir-fry until the ingredients are mixed well.
Add Thai basil leaves to the pan and stir-fry until they are wilted.
In a separate pan, fry an egg over medium heat until the whites are set but the yolk is still runny.
Serve the stir-fried pork over rice and top with the fried egg.

name: Moo Ping
description: Grilled pork skewers marinated with fish sauce, garlic, and coconut milk, served with sticky rice and dipping sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch strips
Bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
Sweet chili dipping sauce, for serving
instructions: In a bowl, mix together fish sauce, oyster sauce, soy sauce, palm sugar, coconut milk, garlic, and black pepper.
Add the pork to the marinade and mix well. Marinate for at least 1 hour.
Thread the pork onto the soaked bamboo skewers.
Grill the skewers over medium-high heat for about 10 minutes, flipping occasionally, until cooked through.
Serve with sticky rice and sweet chili dipping sauce.

name: Laab Gai
description: A spicy minced chicken salad with lime juice, fish sauce, and roasted rice powder.
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add the ground chicken.
Cook the chicken until browned and no longer pink, breaking it up into small pieces with a spatula.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set it aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, shallots, scallions, mint leaves, and cilantro.
Add lime juice, fish sauce, roasted rice powder, and chili peppers to taste.
Mix well and serve with sticky rice or lettuce leaves.
